verses.text: 耶和華的話臨到毗土珥的兒子約珥：

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.heading: Introduction

verses.text: 老年人哪！你們要聽這話。這地所有的居民啊！你們要留心聽。在你們的日子，或在你們祖先的日子，曾有這樣的事嗎？
verses.heading: A Locust Plague Foreshadows the Day of the Lord

verses.text: 你們要把這事傳與子，子傳與孫，孫傳與後代。

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the object acted upon by the verb.
More formal/biblical way of saying 'pass to'.
Here refers to the next generation.
Here refers to the generation after '子'.

verses.text: 剪蟲剩下的，蝗蟲吃了；蝗蟲剩下的，蝻子吃了；蝻子剩下的，螞蚱吃了。

words.note: A type of locust or insect mentioned in the Bible, possibly 'palmerworm'.
A type of locust, possibly 'cankerworm' or 'creeping locust'.
Often refers to grasshoppers; here, a destructive type of locust.

verses.text: 酒醉的人哪！你們要醒過來；要哀哭！所有嗜酒的人哪！你們都要為甜酒哀號，因為甜酒從你們的口裡斷絕了。

words.note: A formal term for deep sorrow and weeping.

breakdown.m: to be fond of, addicted to

words.note: Describes someone who loves or is addicted to alcohol.
Refers to fresh, unfermented or newly fermented wine, often symbolic of joy and prosperity.
A strong expression of grief, a deep wail.
Often implies complete cessation or termination.

verses.text: 因為有一民族上來侵犯我的國土，他們強大又無數；他們的牙齒像獅子的牙齒，他們有母獅的大牙。
他們使我的葡萄樹荒涼，折斷了我的無花果樹，把樹皮剝盡，丟在一旁，使枝條露白。

words.note: Lit. 'tree without flower fruit'
Refers to exposing the white wood under the bark.

verses.text: 你們要哀號，像少女腰束麻布，為她幼年時許配的丈夫哀號一樣。

words.note: Literally 'waist bound', describing wearing sackcloth.
A coarse cloth, often worn as a sign of mourning or repentance.

verses.heading: A Call to Lament

verses.text: 素祭和奠祭都從耶和華的殿裡斷絕了，事奉耶和華的祭司也都悲哀。

words.note: An offering of flour, oil, and frankincense without meat.
An offering of wine poured out before the Lord.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Often used in a religious context for serving God.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 田野荒廢，土地淒涼，因為五穀毀壞，新酒乾竭，油也缺乏。

words.note: Refers to the five main grains of ancient China, but often generally means 'all grains'.

verses.text: 農夫啊！你們要為大麥和小麥羞愧。修理葡萄園的啊！你們要哀號，因為田間的莊稼都破壞了。

words.note: Contextually refers to tending a vineyard.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun 'those who prune the vineyard'.
Indicates completed action or change of state.

verses.text: 葡萄樹枯乾，無花果樹衰殘；石榴樹、棕樹、蘋果樹，田野所有的樹木都枯乾，因此歡樂從人間消失了。

words.note: Lit. 'tree without flower fruit'.

verses.text: 祭司啊！你們要腰束麻布，並且痛哭。在祭壇侍候的啊！你們要哀號。事奉我的 神的啊！你們披上麻布進去過夜吧，因為素祭和奠祭，都從你們的 神的殿中止息了。

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a noun 'those who serve at the altar'.
The leading space indicates reverence for 'God' in Chinese Bibles.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun 'those who serve my God'.
The leading space indicates reverence for 'God' in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 你們要把禁食的日子分別為聖，召開嚴肅會，聚集眾長老和國中所有的居民，到你們的 神耶和華的殿裡，向耶和華呼求。

words.note: Introduces object before verb, emphasizing disposal.
Lit. 'separate as holy'.
The leading space indicates reverence for 'God' in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 哀哉那日！因為耶和華的日子臨近了；那日來到，好像毀滅從全能者臨到一樣。

words.note: Lit. 'the all-able one'.

verses.text: 糧食不是在我們的眼前斷絕了嗎？歡喜與快樂不是從我們的 神的殿中止息了嗎？

words.note: Lit. 'in front of the eyes'.
More formal than '和'.
Capitalized 'S' in pinyin indicates 'God' as a proper noun.
Refers specifically to the temple building.

verses.text: 穀種在土塊底下朽爛，倉庫荒涼，穀倉破爛被拆毀，因為五穀都枯乾了。

words.note: Refers to the five main types of grain, a general term for all cereals.

verses.text: 牲畜發出哀鳴，牛群到處流蕩，因為沒有草場給牠們，羊群也同樣受苦。
耶和華啊！我向你呼求，因為火吞滅了曠野的草場，火燄燒盡了田間所有的樹木。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Often used in a strong, destructive sense in scripture.

verses.text: 田野的走獸也向你發喘，因為溪水都乾涸了，火吞滅了曠野的草場。

words.note: Refers specifically to land-dwelling wild animals.
Often used in a strong, destructive sense in scripture.
